TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit ToolboxItemContainer extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

remarks.format:
## Remarks ToolboxItemContainer is a simple class that encapsulates a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> for efficiency. By having a single class that is always loaded, you can defer the loading of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> until it is needed. Because new classes can be derived from <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>, you could load a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> that could, in turn, load an assembly that is not already in memory. For a large collection of <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> objects, this could cause a large number of assemblies to be loaded, which decreases performance. Instead, the toolbox service deals only with ToolboxItemContainer objects and retrieves their contained <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> only when necessary.
The ToolboxItemContainer is designed to hold any cached data from the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>. The default implementation only holds the filter of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>, but deriving classes may choose to cache the name, image, and other information. ToolboxItemContainer objects support two forms of serialization: they can be serialized through standard runtime serialization, and they can also load and save themselves from a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject?displayProperty=fullName>. The former provides a very easy way to save ToolboxItemContainer objects to a persistent storage. The latter provides a way to integrate ToolboxItemContainer objects with mixed data storage formats.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The containerâ€™s cache of information is filled by accessing properties on the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject data) cil managed

Docs.param: A data object that represents a .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `data` parameter may contain data provided by the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> class. It may contain data that can be read by one of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> creators that have been supplied by the user. It may also be data with a clipboard format that has a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> creator assigned to it. In this case, the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is created on demand.

Docs.summary: Returns a collection of objects that represent the current filter for the .
Docs.returns: A collection of objects. This never returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `creators` parameter is a collection of <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreator> objects that represent any custom <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> creators that should be included when the filter is generated. Custom creators may contribute to the filters. This parameter can be `null` if no creators are needed.
The types stored in a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> may have a filter associated with them. Filters can be used to restrict the tools that can be placed on designers.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem GetToolboxItem(class System.Collections.ICollection creators) cil managed

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `creators` parameter is a collection of <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreator> objects that represent any custom <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> creators that should be included when the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is obtained. This parameter can be `null` if no creators are needed.
The GetToolboxItem method returns a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> that represents the data stored in the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer>. GetToolboxItem never returns `null`, nor does it ever raise an exception, except in extreme cases (for example, out of memory). If a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> cannot be fabricated, the appropriate exception is embedded within a special <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>. The exception is thrown when the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponents%2A> method on this special <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is called. This puts the exception at the point of user action.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the underlying toolbox item has been deserialized.
Docs.value: if the underlying toolbox item has been deserialized; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface.

## Remarks The ToolboxData property creates the serialized version of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>. The data object can be used by an application to store this <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>. This data object is fabricated from the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>, if necessary.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void UpdateFilter(class System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem item) cil managed

Docs.param: The source of the filter to merge with the container's filter.
Docs.summary: Merges the container's filter with the filter from the given item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You should call the UpdateFilter method when the toolbox item is modified or configured. You should also call it if a new <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptionProvider>, which the changes the filter, is added.
